answers.answer: WAIT!!!!  WHAT???  I am recently diagnosed with HYPER.  I have not started the PTU yet, as I am so afraid to.  What was your situation - PLEASE, I need to know!!!  Why no meds?  Did you just decide not to so anything???  Did you hsve symptoms???  How many nodules and how big??  OH!  And CONGRATULATIONS on this WONDERFUL NEWS!!!!Shari
Congratulations!Hope the good news keeps coming.:o)

I was diagnosed with Graves/hyperthyroidism over 1 1/2 years ago. I've been on Methimazole for most of that time.  I went off it and doing the low-iodine diet getting ready to have RAI therapy. Two weeks later,  I had labs done to see how much radiation I was going to need and the labs were normal.  So, I stayed off an additional 4 weeks, had labs done, and they were ALSO normal.  TG I didn't have the radiation unnecessarily!
See ShariI told you it happens.

Even though I am so happy for you - I also had the same situation, only my endo did the RAIMy guts aches to think that maybe if I would have had a good doc - maybe I could have wrote a wonderful post like this too.I did not understand the disease as I do now. IF only I would have known about Graves and Hyperthyroid before I trusted  the endo - I may not be so miserable at times now. and like the walking dead for 6 yrs after RAI.This stripped me of the life I had - I am better after 6 yrs - but not me - at least not who I was.I am happy you are better.
I would think you would need TSI antibody testing to see if Graves had gone into remission.

Graves is an autoimmune disease.  AI diseases are like roller coasters with highs and lows.  Think of other AI diseases like rheumatoid arthritis, lupus, diabetes, etc.....they have times when they "flare" and times of "remission" where they are in active. It seems very plausible to me that you very right and probably are in remission -- just makes sense!  But, the question is, like the other diseases, how long will it last?  I hope a good long, long time!!! Congratulations!

Thank you! I still kind of wonder how far into "remission" I really am as I still get those "heart flutters" every once in a while and 2 days last week, I felt so wired, like I'd had 3 cups of coffee, but I've had almost no caffeine since doing the low iodine diet almost 2 months ago. (I do have a soda once in a while)  I think I'm going to see my primary doctor and have him explain more to me about this plus diet guidlines since I've gained a LOT of weight back and I was already overweight to begin with.
I'm not sure if he did TSI testing? Is that bloodwork? I only remember TSH, T3 and T4 levels being checked off on my lab slips....hmmm.BTW...anyone read The Thyroid Solution? Its very interesting!!
It's on my books to read list :)  I have 5 to get through!TSH T3 and T4 are only measuring thyroid not antibodies as Graves.TSI is the range of antibodies though your system to indicate Graves.

question: My labs are all coming back normal now without medication, so the endo has declared me in remission!! But my question is...if I'm in remission from hyperthyroidism, does that mean the Grave's is in remission too??I will be having another ultrasound soon to check on the nodules that are there to see what they're up to....have they grown, shrunk, stayed the same?...we'll find out soon enough.
title: I'm in REMISSION!!! Yay!...I think??
